title: The Short-Term Predictability of Returns in Order Book Markets: a Deep Learning Perspective. (arXiv:2211.13777v3 [q-fin.CP] UPDATED)
abstract: In this paper, we conduct a systematic large-scale analysis of order book-driven predictability in high-frequency returns by leveraging deep learning techniques. First, we introduce a new and robust representation of the order book, the volume representation. Next, we carry out an extensive empirical experiment to address various questions regarding predictability. We investigate if and how far ahead there is predictability, the importance of a robust data representation, the advantages of multi-horizon modeling, and the presence of universal trading patterns. We use model confidence sets, which provide a formalized statistical inference framework particularly well suited to answer these questions. Our findings show that at high frequencies predictability in mid-price returns is not just present, but ubiquitous. translated_title: 订单簿市场中短期回报的可预测性：深度学习视角
translated_abstract: 本文利用深度学习技术对高频回报中基于订单簿的可预测性进行了系统的大规模分析。首先，我们引入了一种新的、稳健的订单簿表示方法——成交量表示。接下来，我们进行了广泛的经验实验，探讨了各种关于可预测性的问题。我们研究了可预测性的提前时期、稳健数据表示的重要性、多时间跨度建模的优势以及普遍交易模式的存在。我们使用模型置信区间提供了一种形式化的统计推断框架，特别适用于回答这些问题。我们的研究结果表明，在高频率中，中间价格回报的可预测性不仅存在，而且普遍存在。深度学习模型的性能强烈依赖于订单簿表示的选择，在这方面，成交量表示似乎具有多种优势。
tldr: 本研究利用深度学习技术对高频订单簿市场中的回报可预测性进行了大规模分析，发现在高频率中，中间价格回报的可预测性普遍存在，并且深度学习模型的性能取决于订单簿表示的选择。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a systematic large-scale analysis of order book-driven predictability in high-frequency returns using deep learning techniques. The findings show that predictability in mid-price returns is ubiquitous at high frequencies, with the performance of deep learning models depending on the choice of order book representation.
